titleStmt.title: Lizzie Williams to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4613

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Your petitioner would respectfully submit to your Excellency the following statement of facts. and ask the remission of the fine here after mentioned.

At the In January 1864, your petitioner was broughh before the Lexington Cty Court on a charge of carrying a concealed deadly weapon. Upon the testimony a fine of $50 & costs was inflicted. Your Petitioner is a free woman of color. and at the time of the trial was in the employ of Mr William Williams, of Lexington, as house keeper and superintendant of his affairs.

Your petition was arrested when on the premises of Mr Williams and in the discharge of her duty -- Mr Williams, at the time, was absent in Louisville on business. She says she had, when arrested, a kitchen butcher knife which the wintesses said was concealed.

She was ignorant of any law against carrying concealed weapons and pleads her ignorance in mitigation of the offence. The costs have been paid, including attys fee of 30 per cent, and prays your excellency to remit the ballance.
We the undersigned would respectfully request the remission of the above fine --

The fine was inflicted by the Judge of the City Court and was brought up before the City council for remission; but before the question was taken were we were informed it was a state law and that we had no right to remit, We believe you should exercise your clemency to remit the fine

Jos. Wingate Mayor
Wm Murphy City Marshal Lex
J W Cochraal
Wm D Bruce
B G. Bruce
James Chrystal
E H Parrish
John W Lee.
Thos Smith
O A Reynolds
Wesley Spencr
D. F. Wolf } Members of the City Council &c vos
Chas H Wickliff Dep
Geo K Letcher Clk Lex City Ct
M. G. Thompson
We are close Neighbors of Mr Williams's

W P. Nichols-
Z. Lanckart } 4th House on same side 1st adjoining Lot Same fence Between

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette

Lexington City Ct
vs
Lizzie Williams
$50
concealed Weapons
19th Feby 1864
